}}</ref> The arrest of two Brazilian journalists in Cairo on 2 February prompted the Ministry of External Relations to raise its tone in remarks about the political crisis in Egypt.<ref>http://www.estadao.com.br/noticias/internacional,apos-prisao-de-jornalistas-no-egito-itamaraty-eleva-tom,674951,0.htm</ref> it "deplore[d] the violent clashes [and] denounce[d] the arrests of Brazilian journalists Corban Costa, from [[RÃ¡dio Nacional]], and Gilvan Rocha, from [[TV Brasil]], and expects that Egyptian authorities take the appropriate measures to uphold the civil liberties and to protect the population at large and the foreigners on the ground from bodily harm."<ref>[[Press release]] (3 February 2011). [http://www.itamaraty.gov.br/sala-de-imprensa/notas-a-imprensa/situacao-no-egito-1 "Situation in Egypt"]. [[Ministry of External Relations (Brazil)|Brazilian Ministry of External Relations]]. Retrieved 3 February 2011.</ref>
[[File:Obama calls Mubarak Oval Office Jan 2011.jpg|thumb|U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] speaks on the phone with Mubarak during the protests]]
[[File:Obama calls Mubarak Oval Office Jan 2011.jpg|thumb|U.S. President [[Barack Obama]] speaks on the phone with Mubarak during the protests]]
{{quote box|width=216px|quote="Violence will not address the grievances of the Egyptian people, and suppressing ideas never succeeds in making them go away.... Around the world governments have an obligation to respond to their citizens.... All governments must maintain power through consent, not coercion. That is the single standard by which the people of Egypt will achieve the future they deserve."|source=â Barack Obama<ref>{{cite web|author=Werner, Erica|url=http://wokv.com/common/ap/2011/01/29/D9L1UHTG0.html |title=Obama Admonishes Egypt's Mubarak on Protests |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[WOKV]]'') |date=undated (copyright 2011) |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hJYBPPuG4Y1vq7XMe3NnsL7yOqRQ?docId=e5469a82800b40e498667d555837548f |title=Obama Calls for Restraint, Reform in Egypt |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[Google News]]'') |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/index.php?pid=88942&st=&st1=|title=Remarks on the Situation in Egypt|publisher=John T.
